lines.text: All right, Xayide. I will make my last wish. I wish... for you to have a heart!

[Nimbly is viewing a memory that Bastian just lost]
Don't be afraid, Bastian. We are all a part of a never ending story.
We are? Even when we die?
Yes, Bastian. We are.

[on the verge of tears]
That's good to know.

[reading that Bastian has mounted and attempted to direct Artax]
My son on a horse? He can't ride a horse!

[spotting Bastian with the book]
Put it back!
[Bastian jumps and ends up slamming the book shut]
That book has too much on you.
But it's "The NeverEnding Story." I've already read it.
Ahh, but have you ever read a book twice? Books change each time you read them.
Atreyu, get real.
But I am real. What do you mean by "getting real?"
Nothing. It's a joke.
Being real is a joke in your world?

[Koreander's address, which he claims he found in the book's jacket, can now be found by neither of them]
I'm an engineer. I see what I see when I see it.
Well, that's an interesting concept.
My son has been missing since last night.

[takes the book in his hand]
That's pretty heavy reading for a boy. Maybe you'll find an explanation for your son's disappearance *inside*.

[holds up a hand]
Give me five.
Five what?
Forget it.
Bastian made a wish, didn't he?
He gave up a very special memory.

[to Bastian]
Your mother would've been proud.

[confused]
Who?
Falkor, you shouldn't have let him!

[Bastian won't jump off the high diving board]
What's the matter?
I've got a cramp.
High wimp factor, Bastian.
You going out tonight?
Yeah, uh, technical sales staff seminar. Listen...

[sarcastically]
Is Miss Station Wagon going to pick you up again?
Why do you say that?

[hesitates]
The tie.
Oh, uh, yeah. Well, dressing is common courtesy, Bastian. I mean I - something you ought to learn, by the way. Look at that old rag you're wearing.

[feeling hurt from what he said]
I like it!
Well, I don't.
Mom made it.
[His father stares at him]

[looking sad]
You don't remember, do you?
[a car horn is heard]
Gotta go.
[His father quickly leaves]
We need weapons.
I wish for... a spray can!
[a can appears in his hand]
That's a weapon in your world?
Yeah. People use it against walls.
Those walls must be dangerous.
Junior, when are you ever going to learn the difference between a rock and a nose?
I wish for the most horrifying flying dragon in the history of Fantasia!
[as he's speaking, the dragon slowly appears behind him]
I wish him to be red. No, no, green! I wish he can fly as fast as the concord and stink so bad that he makes us sick. And he breathes fire. I'll call him Smurg.
Maybe you should wish for some modifications.

[turns around and sees the dragon]
Oh, no!

[watching from her castle]
Oh, yes!
You have found the only wish powerful enough to save us, Bastian. The emptiness cannot be destroyed; it had to be filled with love.

[takes off the Auryn and gives it to her]
And Auryn?
Is only a mirror of what's inside of you, Bastian. Courage comes from the heart; not from symbols.
You saved my life, Atreyu.
Yes. But you would have done the same for me.

[after a pause]
Sure.
Mr. Koreander?
Huh?
Do you carry how-to books?
How-to books? Does this place look like a supermarket? If you want advice on how to buy real estate or housebreak your goldfish, go to the video store down the street.
You've just taught some giants how to swim, earthling.

[after the dragon has escaped]
What are we gonna do?
Chase it!
Chase? Did somebody say chase?
Falkor, look! The castle that looks like a hand!
A very mean hand.

[when Smerg is hit by an fire arrow from Horok]
Smerg got zapped!

[holds up a rock]
Is that yum-yum rockie?

[watching the Ivory Tower, thinks]
You're fighting a losing battle, Childlike Empress. Soon, your slick little castle will be as dark as mine.
Do you know Bastian Bux?
Do you ever know anybody?
Bastian, in your world, if the Neverending Story is fading, no child will ever know about Junior.
They will never ride the prairie with me?
And they'll never ride through the clouds with me?
If humans forget about us, nobody will think of fun things for Junior to do.
NO!
[Bastian goes silent for a few seconds]
We won't let that happen.

[as they reach the castle]
Do you remember what to say?
Yeah.
Make it loud.

[quietly]
The Earthling, Bastian Balthazar Bux, and Atreyu, the warrior from the Great Plains...

[curiously]
Is that what you call 'loud' in your world?

[shouts louder]
The Earthling, Bastian Balthazar Bux, and Atreyu, the warrior from the Great Plains, demand to see the master of this castle!
That should get somebody's attention.
[huge rumbling occurs]
Guess whose? Atreyu, they make strong gates in Fantasia, don't they?

[after trying to talk to giants]
I like to read... you're probably not to interested in the subject. You probably hate books!
[runs for his life]

[climbing up the castle wall]
I wish for another step! And another one! And another!

[Bastian goes to talk to Atreyu outside the balloon]
Don't be long, Bastian! You will catch a cold!
I can tell when someone lies to me.
And I can tell when someone is up to no good.
Well, from what you tell me, the Emptiness has found its way into Bastian's head.
It's Auryn, isn't it? It works differently with humans than with us.
Because humans need memories.

[goes stunned]
So what I saw... was a memory!
Thief!
I've come to warn you!
Liar!
Don't you EVER say that to me!
But it's the truth! You're jealous because I have Auryn and you've come to take it away from me!
No, I have not!
I overheard you talking to Falkor, so don't even try to make excuses!
You've gone mad, Bastian! Give me Auryn!

[holds it]
She wants ME to have it. You don't understand nothing. Why don't you just go back and play with your buffaloes, country boy!
Why don't you go back and play hero in your own world, Earthling!
[he pauses]
Bastian, every time you use Auryn, you lose one of your memories. Xayide has a - a machine that collects them.

[in disbelief]
I would've seen it! I've been in the...
I have seen it - it is in the roof of the Xobile. A few more wishes, and the Emptiness will possess you! Now, give me Auryn before it's too late.
Take it if you can.
[Atreyn and Bastian get in a severe struggle until Bastian pushes Atreyn down to the ground, Bastian sees this in shock]
YOU BROUGHT THIS ON YOURSELF!

[after Bastian leaves to get to Falkor]
Who told the boy?
It's all Nimbly's fault! He's always hanging around the machine!

[sarcastically]
Oh, thanks for nothing! It's always nice to have someone you can count on!
I do the counting around here.
[Nimbly squawks at Tri Face in anger]
No, it's your fault!
One...
[Bastian gets ready to jump the cliff with Artax]
[she rises her hand and unleashes energy]
...THREE!
[she sends her energy at Bastian making him fall in the raging river]
It's time.

[quietly, to himself as he looks at the machine]
Time to choose sides...
[Xayide looks into Bastian's memory, she sees a window get broken]
The window got broke! I didn't do it!
Do lie to me!
[she then sees Bastian's father leave]
You promised to take me swimming! You promised!
Something's come up.
I HATE YOU!

[thinking]
So that's what humans remember.

[quietly, to himself]
That's a memory Bastian has lost.
[Nimbly makes sounds to wake Bastian up, Bastian wakes up and gasps seeing him]
Wait, Mr. Bastian, wait! I'm not going to hurt you! I've come to help you.

[pants]
You don't give up, do you? You expect me to believe you?

Yes, Mr. Bastian, you have to. I saw... one of your memories... and it made me feel something. I learned that we're all part of a never-ending story. Bastian, try to remember it. Unless you stop Xayide, the story will end. That's why I'm here.
Tell me where I can find Falkor.
At the Silver City, but you won't like what you see.

[goes lost for words]
How do I get there?
Behind those rocks, you find a path through the mountains. One the other side, keep the sun on your back; follow your shadow for half a day. Don't turn round, the Emptiness will be on your heels.
Come with me.

[nervously]
I got the part of a spy in the story, Mr. Bastian. And he who spies and flies away lives to spy another day.
[Nimbly goes still then flies off]
Hurry, Mr. Bastian! Keep the sun on your back!
[Bastian's father sees Mr. Koreander's bookstore completely barren]

[to a policeman, furiously]
There was no "For Sale" sign this morning!
[he bangs on the door in fury]
This is one sophisticated operation, I'm telling you. This morning, this place was filled with books - wall to wall!
[the policeman looks inside]
Looks like there hasn't been a bookstore here for a long time. Are you sure this is the right address.
I am not the kind of person to make things up! Look, I'm an engineer, all right! What I see is what I see... when I...
[he goes lost for words]

[leaves]
We'll do what we can, Mr. Bux.
[Bastian's father goes puzzled]
If Bastian's so clever, why can't he see what's happening to him?
Bastian is losing himself with every wish.
He must be stopped, or Fantasia is lost!
[Bastian, who is invisible, quietly approaches them]
I'll take Auryn away from him - by force if necessary. He can't be allowed to make one more wish. I'll have to do it tonight. Tomorrow we might all be prisoners of Xayide.
[Bastian quickly leaves]
Now, Atreyu, don't go to him in anger; go and warn him. He's your friend, is he?
You're right. He is my friend.
[Falkor smiles]
[after Bastian accidentally killed Atreyu, Bastian goes back to the Xobile and sees the machine and all the memories he had lost, Bastian had realized Atreyu was telling him the truth]

[remorsefully]
You've only two wishes to go.

[as Bastian storms out]
But, my lord...

[sees Falkor soaring in the dark skies carrying Atreyu's lifeless body]
Atreyu, I didn't mean it! Falkor! ATREYU, I'M SORRY!
Now's your chance. Go!

[referring to the giants]
But what about them?
It's a good day to die.
Please don't say that.
